{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3422432,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T20:04:55.470Z","cooked":"

The new REV Servo Hub looks like it’s going to allow CAN control of servos up to 7.4V.

That should open up some new possibilities for using servos in FRC mechanisms. Possibly to replace pneumatics as they have been becoming less common in recent years.

We’ve seen some teams be very successful with servo shifters in the past and some servo release mechanisms in recent years. (like 1690)

With these potential changes in mind.

What are some of your experiences using servos in FRC mechanisms?
Which servos have your teams used?
Can you share examples of mechanisms (photos and/or CAD) where you have successfully used servos?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T20:04:55.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":903,"reads":490,"readers_count":489,"score":4718.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1855/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Servo Hub","clicks":185},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-orbit-1690-2024-robot-cad-release/464838","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC Orbit 1690 2024 Robot CAD Release","clicks":76}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/1","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3422436,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T20:16:43.667Z","cooked":"

In 2020 we used a servo to spin a cam to lock in a custom ratcheting system on our climbing mechanism.

In 2023, and 2024 my team used servos to release to release spring loaded pin mechanisms for single use purposes.

The 2023 mechanism was successful enough for our auto cube kicker that it was replicated by multiple PCH teams and a variation ended up on the 1746 robot that made it to Einstein.

The specific servo we like to use with metal internal gears and high torque.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: JX Servo PDI-6225MG-300 25kg 300 Degree Metal Gear Digital Servo for...

FEATURE: -- 300° 25kg digital servo -- Servo for Robot -- High performance digital standard servo -- High-precision Taiwan-made aluminium gears with hard anodizing -- CNC aluminium middle Shel -- Dual ball bearings SPECIFICATIONS: Max Angle:300°...

$17.99

What about the new servo power hub will enable servo mechanism more than the servo power module? CAN control seems like mainly a QOL change.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T20:20:09.902Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":429,"readers_count":428,"score":135.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/3","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422439,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T20:22:53.014Z","cooked":"

“The Servo Power Module is a 6V 90W” - Servo Power Module - REV Robotics

“Input Voltage: 7V - 20V
Output Voltage*: 5V - 7.4V (6V Default)
Max Total Output Current: 15A” - Servo Hub

7.4V at 15A is 111W

The higher voltage allows for more torque/speed from the servos.

7.4v from 6v is a ~23% voltage increase

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T20:23:53.138Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":413,"readers_count":412,"score":152.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1144/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Servo Power Module - REV Robotics","clicks":25},{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1855/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Servo Hub","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53784,"username":"Max_Morehead","name":"Max Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/4","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422452,"name":"","username":"gopherguts2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gopherguts2/{size}/225780_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T20:51:35.001Z","cooked":"

The roboRIO has a max output of 2.2A across all servos at 6V, whereas the new hub can output 15A across all servos at 7.4v, which makes it both more practical to use high-power servos, but also vastly more practical to use multiple servos without hitting a collective servo power limit.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T20:51:35.001Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":152.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53784,"username":"Max_Morehead","name":"Max Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60546,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3006 Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/5","custom_user_title":"3006 Alumnus","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422459,"name":"tkchan","username":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T21:21:24.959Z","cooked":"

Other than the CAN bus, not sure it’s anything more than the old Servo Booster - Servo Power Module - REV Robotics. So $25 for that, might be worth it if there’s no PWM and only CAN bus.

We’ve used that to power servos (both REV and other brands including metal geared ones). Also used that for driving LEDs as well (those PWM controlled using WPILIB)

[Edit: Actually, maybe this is better since the output would be configurable - so that’s better but also means putting more things on the CAN bus. Wonder how’s the timing with the USB port will be.]

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T21:24:37.154Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":358,"readers_count":357,"score":111.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"tkchan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1144/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Servo Power Module - REV Robotics","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26389,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"think outside of the box from time to time"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/6","custom_user_title":"think outside of the box from time to time","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422466,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T21:49:08.194Z","cooked":"
AllenGregoryIV:

What are some of your experiences using servos in FRC mechanisms?

Very good actually.

Isolate servo gearing via string/cord. You always want the servo pulling on the string, the other deployment force is supplied via a piece of surgical tubing/spring. If the mechanism is hit then " you can’t push a rope" and the gearing is saved.

E.g., 2767 in 2022 (Technically this was a 550 motor)

We also did this for 2451’s cube intake in 2023, I don’t have a picture handy unfortunately. That was “servo up” / “spring down” for a polycarb scoop. The servo had good mechanical advantage as the spring force increased as it retracted.

(To that point, know what you are doing to take advantage of mechanical advantage at different points of the rotation with servos)

" granade pin" to deploy single use mechanisms

@Mark_Wasserman knows all the servo tricks.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T21:55:25.901Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":342,"readers_count":341,"score":148.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/InLqPV_n-5o?si=-T6VtczJtYbt9tX7&t=179","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":35}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/7","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422473,"name":"Cory Walters","username":"Cory_Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cory_walters/{size}/7329_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T22:00:44.703Z","cooked":"

Yep, Grenade pin to release 2018 and 2019 climber and 2017 ball wing. Hi Torque servos to grab and release cubes in 2018. Servos to move gear from flat to vertical in 2017, servo latch to keep shooter down in 2016 while jumping over stuff. multiple servo ratchets over the years. With the new power slots though we have had to rely less on servos recently.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T22:00:44.703Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":317,"readers_count":316,"score":133.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"Cory Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22243,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422476,"name":"CharlesM479","username":"CharlesM479","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/charlesm479/{size}/159395_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T22:20:48.567Z","cooked":"

this is small enough that it could be remote I/O. For example maybe it’s mounted on a turret allowing for 6 servos to be used with only can and power need to go through the cable chain. Opens up some options. Someone will make something very cool with this

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T22:20:48.567Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":125.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"CharlesM479","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30651,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422479,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T22:29:35.066Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

Isolate servo gearing via string/cord. You always want the servo pulling on the string, the other deployment force is supplied via a piece of surgical tubing/spring.

What type of string have you used? Would nylon fishing line be a good choice or something else?

@Cory_Walters It would definitely be valuable to see some pictures of these mechanisms. When imagining mechanisms in the past it’s often been difficult to imagine how to incorporate the rotational motion of typical servos into a latch type mechanism (imagining linear latches is easier for me).

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T22:29:35.066Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":285,"readers_count":284,"score":132.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":22243,"username":"Cory_Walters","name":"Cory Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cory_walters/{size}/7329_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422480,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T22:36:38.156Z","cooked":"
Max_Morehead:

What type of string have you used?

Something that won’t snag easy and doesn’t stretch much. Probably want something in the 1/8" range. I have my doubts about monofilament fishing line, braided line can cut you easily, (haven’t tried those)

If it doesn’t need to wrap on a spool, the thin (1/16" coated cable (wire “rope”), basically glorified fishing leader works) well because it doesn’t dangle. If it does need to go on a spool the small diameter dynema works well.

I’m sure there are loads of things that work well here, I don’t think there is any real secret sauce.

Oh, and another tip: you can use string to place the servo one place and pull the grenade pin somewhere else to deploy a mechanism.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-09-10T22:58:26.256Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":99.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471029,"topic_slug":"frc-servo-mechanisms","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/frc-servo-mechanisms/471029/11","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422483,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-10T22:43:43.462Z","cooked":"

Forgot the fishing pole servos for the “legal” flags for 2018 switch scoring.

2019 safety legs for the climber before those came off.

I don’t think 2020 had any…

Yeah there have been a few, espesially in the CTR power distribution board days. XD

2019
Deployable camera pole for birds eye driving.
REV Smart Servo
This worked but we had some issues keeping the servos alive. This was likely code and shock loading related.

Camera Pole708×923 70.4 KB

IMG_20190309_2028263481920×1440 297 KB

47371728981_4a7b814b3f_k1920×1280 223 KB

2024
Elevator latch to prevent robot from falling at the end of the match.
AndyMark Torque Servo (am-4954) with an additional 3:1 gear reduction.
The latch arm didn’t need to move much so we geared the servo to use more of its range.

Elevator Latch Back969×655 216 KB

Elevator Latch Front1168×937 93 KB

20240307_1953221920×1081 294 KB

With modern servos, I wouldn’t be opposed using them again in the right situation. I think one of the biggest things is adequately supporting the output.

By far our most robust implementation of a servo on 118 was on the preload cube catapult release on our 2023 robot.

We purchased a Swellpro PL1-S Servo Release Mechanism and just put our own connector on the servo and used it with no issues the whole season. It is a perfect solution for a servo driven pin-puller mechanism as it takes the servo itself out of the load path of the mechanism it is locking.

Here is a photo of it on the robot:

Echo-Servo-Puller.PNG1920×1629 193 KB
